collection.translation[0].definitions[0]: a set of similar things that are kept or brought together because they are attractive or interesting
collection.translation[0].definitions[1]: a group of objects together in the same place
a collection of empty wine bottles on the back porch
collection.translation[0].definitions[2]: the act of asking people to give you money for an organization that helps people, or during a church service, or the money collected in this way
We’ll be taking up a collection at the end of tonight’s service.
Every Christmas we have a collection for a local charity.
collection.translation[0].definitions[3]: the act of obtaining money that is owed to you
collection.translation[0].definitions[4]: the act of bringing together things of the same type from different places to form a group
collection.translation[0].definitions[5]: the act of taking something from a place
Garbage collections are made every Tuesday morning.
Please collect your purchases from the customer collection point.
collection.translation[0].definitions[6]: the clothes designed by a fashion company for a particular season
collection.translation[0].definitions[7]: several stories, poems, pieces of music etc that are in one book or on one record
a new collection of Frost’s poetry
collection.translation[0].definitions[8]: a group of people, especially people you think are strange or unusual in some way
There was an interesting collection of people at the wedding.
